title: Will Ashe be getting any love anytime soon?
body:
Feels pretty miserable to play her. Between the straight nerfs in the preseason patch, the tenacity/slow-resist mastery, the ever-expanding League of Mobility, and Boots of Swiftness becoming popular on basically everyone, the so-called "utility marksman" can't slow anyone for shit. Even Kindred has better slowing power than Ashe.

I don't really care if you have to nerf her damage to compensate, but Riot please make Frost Shot a useful ability again. Right now it feels like there's no real reason to pick Ashe over Kalista.

http://i.imgur.com/P63OnX4.png

replies.body: We're going to be assessing Ashe's state in the next patch or two, it does feel like she's in a somewhat rough state at the moment. Having said that we'll probably be looking at the amount of overall move speed/slow resist being bought first. If our conclusion's that that's out of line (as opposed to different from the historical state, but appropriate) we might hold off on Ashe changes while we nerf other things that are strong against her.

You do realize how many things you'd have to nerf/balance if you don't touch Ashe at all? Swifties, Stormraiders, Other champions that do her job of slowing but better and does more *cough BlueEz*cough* and that's off the top of my head, there's prolly a lot more.

If Ezreal, Swifties or Stormraider's are overall problems we need to address then we'll need to do that regardless of Ashe's state - she's not the reason for the changes, but could be impacted by them. The degree of impact might be minor, or might be major, it's certainly worth assessing though.

You do realize it's better to treat a problem rather than just a symptom? It's hardly so simple as "Ashe just doesn't slow enough".

Ashe's poor performance is the symptom in this case.

Fixing the underlying problems--those being the decrease in slow power since the preseason changes--could alleviate some amount of Ashe's problems as well.

Do your internal data on her differ much from champion.gg's stuff? There, she's showing somewhat of a lower pick rate since preseason (from ~4.5% to ~2.5%), but after her buffs on 5.24, when the number of stacks to trigger Q was lowered to 4 from 5, she has a comfortable winrate of around 51.3-51.7%. That looks to me like a somewhat niche champion, but one that is generally more successful than not if she is picked.

In that context, are there any plans to deal with Blue Ezreal? I mean, he is somewhat intruding on Ashe's territory as the slowing/kiting based ADC...

How do you define **utility**?  
How would you classify Ezreal with a "blue" item build?
Lissandra has a "high utility" ult, self-displacement, slows and a root. How does her mobility or damage fare in comparison to other "high utility" champions?
In terms of kiting, how well do you kite as Ashe in comparison to a Lucian/Ezreal/Graves with what essentially amounts to built-in "mini-flashes" ? Or a hop-happy Kalista? 
In terms of initiation, how often is a max distance, max duration stun on a long-shot Enchanted Arrow really benefit the team?

> In terms of initiation, how often is a max distance, max duration stun on a long-shot Enchanted Arrow really benefit the team?

A shit ton. The answer is an absolute shit ton. I've had so many games as Ashe where literally the only reason we ever got anything done was because I started fights with arrows. When you hit that 2-3 second stun on someone on the enemy team, you force them into making a very unpleasant choice: Try to counter-engage while someone on your team is stunned, or leave them to die. Ashe once she gets rolling also has DPS comparable to any of the hyped late game carries like Jinx, Vayne, and Tristana. Ashe's only real weakness as this point is a lack of mobility, and if you're willing to play around that, she is very, very strong.

Reworks are slightly different only because they actually change the champion in a meaningful way that makes them more enjoyable to play even after they eventually get nerfed. But straight buff and nerfs to champions get really repetitive and irritating and I'm really tired of the "underplayed=weak and needs buffs" trend Riot and this community has taken the last few years. I remember back during early Season 4 when Riot gave Tristana small buff after small buff for like 4 patches and then suddenly she's the best adc in the game by far as soon as the adc items change. I remember when Elise was considered terrible, they gave her small buff after small buff, finally relented and gave her a big buff, and now she's pick or ban in every single game. I remember when they buffed Sejuani multiple times at the beginning of Season 5, made her broken when Cinderhulk came out, and had to absolutely gut her burst damage to compensate for it. Hecarim also got small buffs over time until he became a completely dominant top laner and had to be nerfed multiple times to bring him into line. We're at the tail end of the "Buff Lux slowly until she's OP" trend. And guess what's going to happen to Xin Zhao 3 patches from now? He's going to get nerfed hard because they're giving a huge buff to a fairly balanced champion now. Ashe will be the same once they decide to buff her. Mark my words on that one.

I agree buffs are dangerous and people shouldn't call for buffs just because a champ is no longer FotM. I've played Ashe for a long time and love playing the champ (my 2nd highest mastery) and will continue to play her regardless of what happens, but I can clearly see she is not nearly as good as before the preseason. Her slow got nerfed hard (5-25% vs 5-35% is a big deal, a decaying critical slow does not make up for that), her Q got nerfed, thankfully they didn't touch her ult (they probably never will, it's a good ult) but it really hurt the OTHER reason you would pick Ashe for, which is her easily applied slow letting you chase enemies and helping your team to clean up fights.

The reason I think Ashe can handle a buff is two-fold:

1st, she is very specialized. She very much has a lot of her power budget in ECA and Hawkshot, so as a result her DPS is good, bur not as good as other carries who specialize in DPS like Draven or Vayne. She has essentially ZERO burst, not even the ability to get lucky crits, so champs like Lucian or Corki beat her in that easily. Her reach is not that great, compared to her auto range Volley is pretty long range compared to her autos, and it helps her lane a lot, but you look at other carries' options like Corki's rockets, Ezreal's Mystic Shot, Lucian's Culling etc. She doesn't have the option to contribute DPS to a fight when it's unsafe to autoattack, at best she can contribute 1.0 AD to the enemy frontline every 4s, that's it.

2nd, she has exploitable weaknesses. Which is kind of based on her specialization. She has ZERO mobility. No blinks, no dashes, no movespeed boosts, and the lowest base MS in the game. She CANNOT handle an assassin or bruiser diving her and gibbing her. Her specialization means she has no way of really retaliating, even with perfect orbwalking, many bruisers like Vi, Xin, etc. will catch up to an Ashe with impunity and kill her before she kills them. At best she can try to point-blank stun them, which is a good defense, but is heavily reliant on her biggest and most impactful cooldown and only deals with one threat for one second. There's also the fact that there are a lot more abilities nowadays which can counteract her initiation. Doesn't matter that you landed a great arrow on the enemy ADC if Tahm just eats them and walks away, or Kindred ults them and turns your engage on its head. 

What does this all mean? It means Ashe has a "release valve" on her kit. Even if her numbers are so strong that she becomes a hotly contested pick, counters will naturally pop up to ensure she never totally dominates the meta. That's why I think it's safe to buff her.

Unless they completely revert to relaunch Ashe (when she was first reworked) she will never reach OP. Her laning phase is atrocious since she has ONE ability until level 6 and then she gets a whopping 2. She has to literally get carried out of lane by her support and will STILL do less damage than most carries on similar items. She is outclassed in kiting by Ez and Kalista by a LONG shot and does significantly less damage than the other "immobile" ADCs such as Jinx and soon to be buffed Sivir.
